title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure soil is moist before transplanting
Use clean, appropriate tools for handling seedlings (fingers, tools)
Gently remove seedlings from trays, being careful not to damage stems
Plant seedlings deeper than in previous cells to encourage root growth
Water seedlings thoroughly after transplanting
Monitor for signs of transplant shock and adjust care accordingly
Repeat process for multiple seedlings and varieties
Maintain proper humidity and lighting conditions post-transplant
Harden off seedlings before outdoor planting in zones with potential frost
Plan outdoor planting date based on local frost-free window
Gradually acclimate seedlings to outdoor conditions over 1-2 weeks
Protect seedlings from extreme weather or pests during hardening-off period
Check soil temperature and weather forecasts before transplanting
Dig planting holes at appropriate depth and spacing for tomato plants
Apply appropriate mulch or compost around plants for nutrient enrichment
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Fertilize when new growth appears, but avoid over-fertilizing immediately post-transplant
Monitor plants for pests and diseases, taking appropriate action as needed
Provide support structures (stakes, cages) for tomato plants to prevent damage
Harvest tomatoes when they reach mature color and are firm
Rotate crops annually to prevent soil-borne diseases
Track individual variety progress and note any specific care requirements
Cross-pollinate between compatible varieties for varied seed production
Keep detailed notes on plant performance for future reference
